image.altText: Netanyahu, wearing a yellow ribbon pin and an Israeli flag pin, raises a finger and looks serious.

props.synopsis: Israel's prime minister has flagged his government's intention to take full control of Gaza and hand it over to Arab forces to govern. Follow live.

title.children: Protesters rally in Israel as Netanyahu's cabinet considers Gaza occupation plan

image.altText: Anthony Albanese

props.synopsis: Australia has little influence on what's happening in the Middle East but the Australian public is increasingly horrified by the images of the humanitarian crisis.

title.children: Anthony Albanese marches cautiously towards Palestinian recognition

image.altText: Ginny Jones looking at photos

props.synopsis: Jai Gray disappeared from his home in Morayfield, north of Brisbane, in June last year. His body was found in a quarry about two weeks later.

title.children: Family of 'disappeared' man says police 'wiped their hands clean of him'

image.altText: A sign outside Sydney Children's Hospital

props.synopsis: The death of a six-year-old girl who was twice sent home for Sydney Children's Hospital has been referred to a coroner.

title.children: Girl, 6, dies after twice being sent home by Sydney hospital

image.altText: Storm clouds brewing over a rural highway

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump's proposed cuts to US weather and climate services will cause the loss of critical data Australia relies on for its weather and climate modelling.

title.children: The storm brewing over the world's weather data could reach Australia's forecasts

image.altText: A textured beige backdrop with a man in a wheelchair and a man with a cane. They're framed by blue and orange shapes

props.synopsis: The way many people view disability forces those living with it to work within the limitations of a world not designed for them. Could a shift in mindset help move the dial on inclusion?

title.children: Forget what you think you know about disability. It might be all wrong

image.altText: A  128-foot yacht sits docked in the harbour on a sunny day.

props.synopsis: After more than three years, Russia claims it has become immune to Western sanctions as the US threatens new severe measures if a ceasefire is not agreed by August 8.

title.children: After more than three years, Russia claims it's 'immune' to sanctions

image.altText: Two men speak at a press conference at the White House.

props.synopsis: With Thailand, Cambodia, and Pakistan receiving reduced tariff rates in Donald Trump's latest negotiations, it appears there is a pattern of "good deals" among those who accept his intervention in the region.

title.children: Trump leveraging peacekeeping in tariff 'deals' across Asia

image.altText: Murray Watt speaking at a press conference.

props.synopsis: The environment minister says it is "disappointing" some countries, including the United States, are actively trying to sink a global treaty to tackle plastic pollution. Follow live.

title.children: Murray Watt says US push to sink global plastics treaty is 'disappointing'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: David Shoebridge says Israel should face sanctions if it takes full control of Gaza
Watt says final decision on North West Shelf shouldn't be far away
Murray Watt says US push to sink global plastics treaty is 'disappointing'

props.synopsis: It's been a big week for the ASX 200 and investors are nearing the peak of a hair-raising psychological journey. But some are peering through their fingers, wondering what's coming next — and when?

title.children: Investors near 'euphoria' as share market rollercoaster roars on

image.altText: Siena wearing green tshirt laughs while her brother's wife paints in the foreground.

props.synopsis: First Nations youth have put forward their demands to leaders in Canberra, and they have asked for a "real response".

title.children: 'We mean business': Meet the young people taking their demands to the PM

image.altText: A man in a red puffer jacket stands in front of fire trucks

props.synopsis: The former voice of Big Brother Australia, Mike Goldman, has narrowly escaped a house fire in Brisbane's inner-east with his wife and one-year-old son.

title.children: Former voice of Big Brother narrowly escapes house fire with wife and baby

image.altText: US Federal Reserve building in Washington, DC.

props.synopsis: The US president wants to fill a temporary vacancy on the US central bank board with his adviser, Stephen Miran. On Wall Street, the Dow fell while the Nasdaq rose. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Trump appoints economic advisor to US Fed board

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX Ltd faces financial hit from ASIC inquiry
QBE half-year profit rises 27 per cent
Stephen Miran's Fed appointment a 'welcome surprise'

image.altText: David Brewster, George Town Airport Association President

props.synopsis: Friends of a missing pilot feared something had gone wrong soon after take-off, and were so worried they took to the sky to search.

title.children: Right from take-off, friends of missing pilot knew something was off

image.altText: Steph Catley adjusts her captain's armband while playing for the Matildas.

props.synopsis: Matildas captain Steph Catley is one of 30 nominees for the Ballon d'Or Feminin, the top individual international award in football.

title.children: Steph Catley the latest Matilda shortlisted for top football award

image.altText: A red and brown sign like a house with a horse painting, Moonan Flat written and upper hunter shire underneath.

props.synopsis: The Moonan Flat Pub was once bustling with regulars and tourists, but its closure has left locals fearing it could spell the end of the town.

title.children: Fears tiny town will die as 130-year-old pub closes its doors

image.altText: An illustration of a retro TV showing a black-and-white image of a woman screaming in terror.

props.synopsis: What is it about religious horror movies that terrifies and captivates us?

title.children: Like horror movies? You could be a 'dark coper'

image.altText: Rows of trucks are parked next to several shipping containers stacked on top of the other.

props.synopsis: Major trading partners including Brazil and India are among economies yet to strike a deal with the Trump administration.

title.children: Trump's higher tariffs on major trading partners officially kick in

image.altText: APY Lands general manager Richard King.

props.synopsis: The controversial reappointment of APY Lands general manager Richard King is under a South Australian government-commissioned review following claims of a flawed recruitment process.

title.children: Reappointment of APY Lands general manager under review

image.altText: A dead marine animal washed up along an Adelaide beach.

props.synopsis: Amid SA's devastating algal bloom, a citizen scientist says she has recorded more than 1,000 observations of dead sea creatures along a 500-metre stretch of a popular Adelaide beach in less than a fortnight.

title.children: Citizen scientist's grim report on algal bloom impact on 500m beach

image.altText: A composite image of three men

props.synopsis: The White House says it is "working through the details" after the Kremlin said the leaders were likely to meet soon.

title.children: Donald Trump and Vladimir Putin could meet as soon as next week

image.altText: Portrait of a white-breasted bird with blue cap and yellow eye against a black background.

props.synopsis: We teamed up with photographers to find out how use a smartphone to take wildlife images, snap tiny creatures, and catch birds in action.

title.children: These photos were taken with a smartphone — and you can do this too

image.altText: men hold hands.

props.synopsis: Defence officials from the two countries agree to allow observers from the regional bloc to inspect disputed border areas and help ensure hostilities do not resume.

title.children: Cambodia and Thailand agree to ASEAN observers to ensure ceasefire holds

image.altText: Two researchers rehearsing their TED talks on a stage.

props.synopsis: According to the Aussie experts gearing up for their first TED talk this weekend, storytelling is key — but breaking down a subject you understand so deeply, to share that knowledge with the world, comes with a whole lot of nerves.

title.children: How do you prepare a TED talk? Everyday experts share their process

image.altText: A close up of handwritten letters

props.synopsis: There are almost 10,000 letters in the AWM private collection. These latest letters "fill" a gap.

title.children: John's family wrote him letters, not knowing if he was dead or alive

image.altText: Peter George and Craig Garland speak to a media huddle.

props.synopsis: Members of Tasmania's new crossbench have criticised Labor's reluctance to engage with Greens — but described their talks with the party as "interesting" and "productive".

title.children: Mixed reviews after Tasmanian crossbencher meetings with Labor

image.altText: Torn netting above a heavy blanket of snow, with a few small trees peeking out from under the snow.

props.synopsis: A spectacular snowstorm leaves the last commercial orchard in the NSW Northern Tablelands with "unprecedented" damage.

title.children: Snowstorm leaves 160yo orchard with $500k damage bill

image.altText: A pic of a passport.

props.synopsis: Australia's Pacific neighbour Nauru has sold its first passports as part of a program raising funds for the relocation of residents affected by rising sea levels.

title.children: Nauru sells first passports to help fund relocations as sea levels rise

image.altText: Women in black zip-up stand outside

props.synopsis: She Shapes History has launched a Sydney walking tour route to help raise awareness for the women who helped mould the city, but so often get cast aside.

title.children: Trailblazing women put in spotlight on Sydney walking history tour

image.altText: Woman and girl hold signs while on strike

props.synopsis: A lot happened this week. Did you take it all in? Test your knowledge here.

title.children: Weekly News Quiz: A dancing bird, a Gold Logie winner and teachers go on strike

image.altText: Ezra Mam leans on his haunches during a Brisbane Broncos NRL game.

props.synopsis: The Broncos have paid a heavy price for their loss to Melbourne on Thursday night with Adam Reynolds, Ezra Mam and Selwyn Cobbo suffering hamstring injuries.

title.children: Broncos lose both halves in one play, leaving NRL season in balance

image.altText: Jeremy Howe and Jai Newcombe on the turf after clash

props.synopsis: Jeremy Howe comes off second-best after a brutal head clash with Jai Newcombe in the opening seconds of Hawthorn's 64-point win over Collingwood.

title.children: Howe taken to hospital after 'sickening' clash in Hawthorn win

image.altText: One hand putting a wedding band onto the finger of another hand

props.synopsis: Australians are marrying and divorcing less and having fewer children: it’s emblematic of deep and complex social change.

title.children: Divorces have dropped to their lowest rate since no-fault divorce was introduced

image.altText: Ted Powell laughs at a media conference.

props.synopsis: Perth businessman Ted Powell's donation to Murdoch University is the biggest donation ever received by a tertiary institution in the state and was inspired in part by his late wife's love of animals.

title.children: 'Can't spend it': Wealthy philanthropist gives $100 million to vet school

image.altText: Lindsay Lohan and Jamie Lee Curtis peer through a pile of toys in Freakier Friday.

props.synopsis: Freakier Friday is a bubbly, quippy, Disney Channel-style blend of bright colours, battle-of-the-generations comedy and a Chappell Roan soundtrack.

title.children: Freakier Friday isn't a 'great' film — but no-one expected it to be
